attributes.action: Publish, publicly, where the money from Fishing Licences is spent.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Every year, I duly buy my fishing licence (currently £24.50)

After 20 - odd years of fishing, I was finally asked to produce my licence by an Environment Agency Baliff for the first time ever.

He informed me that he was the only Baliff covering the whole of Northamptonshire - and that he only works part-time.

I know a post-mistress and asked her how many rod licences she sells every year.
She was unsure, but said that she had sold 46 full licences in the first 2 months so far (not counting temporary licences)

That is £1,127!

If this is typical of any Post Office and there are (conservative estimate) 200 Post Offices in Northamptonshire, that's £225,400 for one county, in just 2 months!
And they only employ one, part-time baliff!

How much does it total across all the counties of Britain?
Does the administration of licences account for all of this money!
If not, where is the money going?

What are Anglers paying for?
